intro: Leloutrea aplocaryoides, commonly known as the silverleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its basal rosette of silvery, hairy leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces yellow composite flowers that bloom in early spring, followed by distinctive pappus-equipped seeds for wind dispersal. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas. Leloutrea aplocaryoides is a perennial herb with a compact growth habit and is adapted to arid environments.
